author: Klas Stolpe
title: Juneau Empire - Alaska's Capital City Online Newspaper | - Alaska's Capital City Online Newspaper
text:
Away, 8 a.m., ASAA State Tennis Championships at Alaska Club East (all day). 
HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL 
Away, ASAA Large School State Championship Quarter Finals (at higher seed): Dimond at Colony 7 p.m., Bartlett at Chugiak 7 p.m. 
Saturday, October 10 
Home, JDHS/TMHS host JIVE. 
RUNNING 
Home, 10 a.m., Extra Tough 5K and 1-mile walk/run at Riverbend Elementary School covered playground. Empire Cup series race and fundraiser for NAMI (National Alliance on Mental Illness) Juneau. Registration starts at 9 a.m., race fee $10 for 18-under; $20 adults preregistration ($25 race day); $10 for NAMI members. For more information, contact Crystal Bourland at namijuneau@gmail.com . 
CYCLOCROSS 
Home, 3 p.m., Treadwell Mine Cyclocross Bike Race at Sandy Beach. Registration 2:30 p.m., race fee $10. Race starts at upper part of Sandy Beach and riders will do a series of 10 loops on the Treadwell Mine Trails. Any unmotorized bike with at least two wheels will do. For information, contact John McConnochie at 723-1876 or jpm@gci.net . 
HIGH SCHOOL TENNIS 
Away, 8 a.m., ASAA State Tennis Championships at Alaska Club East (all day). 
HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL 
Away, ASAA Medium School State Championship Semi-Finals at Achorageâ€™s Dimond High School Alumni Field: Southeast No.1 North Pole vs. Northern Lights No.2 Kenai at 1 p.m., NLC No.1 Soldotna vs. SEC No.2 Thunder Mountain at 4 p.m. 
Away, ASAA Large School State Championship Quarter Finals (at higher seed): West Valley at East 2 p.m., West at Lathrop 5 p.m. 
Away, ASAA Small School State Championship Semi-Finals (at higher seed): Homer at Eielson 1 p.m., Barrow at Nikiski 4 p.m. 
HIGH SCHOOL SWIMMING 
Away, JDHS at Anchorage. 
BASKETBALL OFFICIALS 
Every Tuesday through October, Basketball Officials Meeting (Oct. 13, 20, 27 and Nov. 3) from 6-8 p.m., room C-105 at Thunder Mountain High School. Discussion of rules & mechanics as preparation for the National Federation of High Schools (NFHS) certification exam. All interested in officiating are encouraged to attend. For more information call Joel Osburn 209-7897. Time to put the Marvelous Mystery Oil on whistles and dust off the zebra stripes. High school basketball officials are in demand this season. 
Friday, October 16
